page.title: 03Rocks and fossils.
page.content: The name of the the rock in our area is{Oolitic}limestone.It looks like caviar or fish roe.The stone was made underwater.Shellfish died,their shells turned into stone to produce the shell fossils we find today.In the{Cotswold} hills most of the fossils belong to the{Brachiopod}family.Lots of things in this area are built with{Oolitic} limestone or{Cotswold stone,}like walls,roofslates and houses.There were two types of{Cotswold stone}slate used for roofing.They are called{Presents} found near the ground surface and{ {Pendle,}dug out from deep in the ground.Slabs of{Pendle}were left out in the open fields so that the winter freeze could split them into thin tiles along their natural strata.The{ {"Getter"}got the slates from the ground,the{"Slatter"}made or used them.The area is characterised by many
